name: World War II Movies Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which WW II movie starred Clark Gable?
questions.explanation:
Command Decision.

	All were WW II, but 'Command' was the best of the group - and one of Gable's better movies.

questions.text: Speaking of Gable, in which of these war movies did Burt Lancaster star with him?
questions.explanation:
Run Silent, Run Deep.

	Again, all choices are WW II movies.

questions.text: In which movie did Tony Curtis play one of the soldiers who hoisted the flag on Iwo Jima?
options: The Man in The Gray Flannel Suit
questions.explanation:
The Outsider.

	Good {movie;} sad (but true ) story. The others feature Peck ('Gray Flannel'), McQueen ('War Lover') and Wayne ('Expendable').

questions.text: Which war movie featured Aldo Ray and Tab Hunter?
questions.explanation:
Battle Cry.

	Good movie. From the Leon Uris novel.

questions.text: Who was NOT a member of the 'Dirty Dozen'?
questions.explanation:
James Coburn.

	Coburn was in 'The Great Escape' - one of the best of the war movies.

questions.text: Which movie starred Spencer Tracy and Van Johnson?
questions.explanation:
Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo.

	'Sands' was one of John Wayne's better known WW II movies.

Peter Graves.

	Great movie. All four choices were in the cast.

questions.text: Which movie deals with a GI's personal readjustment upon returning from WW II?
questions.explanation:
Best Years of Our Lives.

	Fine, solid movie.

questions.text: Who was NOT in 'The Guns of Navarone'?
questions.explanation:
Alec Guinness.

	Guinness did 'Bridge over the River Kwai'.

questions.text: Which one of these non-TV movies is built around WWII?
questions.explanation:
Von Ryan's Express.

	All deal with wars of the twentieth century, but only the Sinatra film is set in WW II.
